intro: Mikania aromatica, commonly known as sweetleaf or aromatic vine, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense heads, typical of the daisy family. Mikania aromatica is often found in moist, shaded areas and can grow up to several meters in length. It is known for its fragrant leaves and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
